alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 3:33PM EDT until July 23 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Daniel Island, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Awendaw, Cainhoy, Wando, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Boone Hall Plantation, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre, Don Holt Bridge, Capers Inlet, Rivertowne, Dunes West, Park West, Mount Pleasant Hospital, Snowden and Beresford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
